text: Elaine Mulqueen (January 27, 1932 – May 22, 2012) was an American children's television host and personality. She was born in Chicago.Bartlett woman starred in Chicago children's television Daily Herald. May 31, 2014. Accessed June 15, 2014 Mulqueen's career in television began in 1962, when she appeared in commercials for Coca-Cola on Bozo's Circus. In 1963, Elaine Mulqueen and her husband began hosting The Mulqueens on WGN-TV. Elaine Mulqueen appeared on stage as a pixie-like character named Pandora.Berger, Daniel; Jajkowski, Steve. "Chicago Television", (p. 51–52) Arcadia Publishing, January 1, 2010. Accessed June 15, 2014 In 1965, the program moved to WBKB-TV (now WLS-TV), and the show was renamed Mulqueen's Kiddie A-Go-Go. On May 22, 2012, Mulqueen died from cancer of unknown primary origin in Chicago at the age of 80. ==References== Category:1932 births Category:2012 deaths Category:Deaths from cancer of unknown primary origin Category:Cancer deaths in Chicago Category:Television personalities from Chicago Category:Models from Chicago
title: Elaine Mulqueen
